comment: This was my first dual enrollment class and I am incredibly thankful to have had him as a professor! It was definitely a class where you had to stay on top of everything, but he gave good feedback and was willing to help us. Be prepared for discussion, reading, lab, and quiz. It is easy to get an A in the class!

One of the easiest classes are taken here at Kennesaw. There's two assignments on McGraw Hill every two weeks and then you also have your discussion question. In module lab every two weeks as well very easy. He does care a lot about the planet I think so. He really wants to engage with the discussion questions.

I would recommend anyone to take this professor and this class if they need their second science credit. I did not put the most effort into this class but I still managed to get a good grade in my opinion. Professor Jun knows a lot and he is seems really nice. Take him!!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very textbook heavy, but the assignments aren't difficult. They're merely tedious, but earning an A isn't hard at all. If you need another science credit and want something simple and easy to get through, take 1112 is Tu. He is also just a nice guy and responds quickly if there are issues with anything.

This was one of the easiest classes I have taken. Dr. Tu has the course laid out very well. The reading assignments are fairly long as well are the labs however you will learn A LOT of valuable information if you actually apply yourself. Extremely easy A, he is very quick with responses as well. I can't comprehend a low score for this man. TAKE HIM

there wasn't much to this professor, he kinda just existed as someone to call on whenever you had an issue. the class is made up of 8 online modules that you complete over the course of the whole semester. and they all are lab quizzes, chapter quizzes, and discussion posts. the homework involves a lot of reading and answering concept questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I took this class online and thought it was rather easy! Professor Tu's class is completely outlined with the same assignments due every two weeks. While this class is work-heavy, it was easily doable. The quizzes are open note and are pretty straightforward. The textbook will be your best friend for the quizzes. I definitely recommend his class!

Dr. Tu is a very kind and caring teacher and is very passionate about the subjects that he teaches. Material for this class is manageable with an online lab, review, discussion post and quiz every two weeks. The reviews take a while to complete so make time for that. No lockdown browser on quizzes and super fun to learn about. Definitely reccomend.

Professor Tu's class was quite easy for me. Although it is a lot of work, you are given 2 weeks to complete the assignments for each chapter. Even though it is work that will take you some time, the work itself is easy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I think he means well, but SUCH A TOUGH GRADER. The labs are impossible. No matter what I did I couldn't get above a 78. There is such a heavy class load. Seems like he doesn't realize that we have other classes too. This is too much for being a gen ed class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader--So many papers

comment: If you want to sit and do hours worth of labs every week then take Professor Tu. He thinks his class is the only thing going on in his student's life. God forbid you do an assignment the day it is due and he will shame you via email and via announcements on D2L. The labs are overly challenging for a gen ed course. Save yourself the struggle.
Do not take this class. You could rewrite a whole geology book and he would still give you an F.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Its an eh class. Labs are alright and discussion posts are easy. Two test, mid term and final open note. nobody did that great on it and there wasnt a curve. lots below a B, no 100s in my class. I even prepared with the list he gave us with quizlets and power points but still just an eh grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I took this course in 4-weeks (summer), and Dr. Tu made it very manageable. Though there is a lot of work, he does his best to help his students understand material. He also gives extensions with valid excuses. If you put in the effort, this can be a nice class.

This class was really interesting and this professor is really nice. He responds to emails if you need help. However, the labs could be a bit confusing at times. We had two tests and they were pretty hard. Discussion posts are easy do raise your grade though.

This class was wayyy harder than it needed to be. This professor expects you to read his 200 page presentations and other 20 resources per module to complete the labs and/or exams. IF he provides video content to explain a hard subject it is videos off of youtube from like 2008.. Discussions were easy though but I would never take this again

He's a really good professor. He responds to emails in a timely manner especially in the pandemic. However, his labs can be difficult to complete sometimes, but if you email him, he is happy to explain it thoroughly to you. He has a midterm and final, 8 labs, and 10 discussions for a whole semester. Just work hard on the labs and study for the exam
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I took the class for 4 weeks, and it wasnt hard. A new chapter every 2-3 days. Each chapter has notes, lab, and discussion post. The labs werent hard, but not super easy. The discussions were easy, just make sure to comment on others. 2 tests worth over 50% of your grade. Both are open book/note, use those they help a lot. Highly recommended him!

You have a discussion post and a lab each week. We took two tests, which were open note, but you did have to understand the concepts. The labs were a bit confusing at times but very much doable. Professor Tu also responds pretty quickly to any questions. Just stay o track and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: There's 2 exams which are open note, open book, they're very hard to fail unless you just didn't read the lectures. The lectures are hard if you take it online since some of it doesn't have an explanation. Hes very caring and if you miss something just email him and hell try his best to help you.

Tests and labs are not too difficult. Fairly lengthy and time consuming but if you follow the lectures they should be fine. Grades are given in a timely manner with decent feedback per assignment. Study a little more than usual for these tests to pull a high B or even an A.
I took Professor Tu online and the class was pretty interesting. There are two exams that count for more than 50% of your grade. Exams are fairly difficult but are not terrible. Would take again!

I took weather and climate with this professor and by far was not one of my best choices. When asking for help make sure to ask way before the due date of an assignment. His lectures did not match up with midterm or final and quite honestly his lectures lacked necessary explanations for maps and terms.

Professor Jun Tu is a great professor. He uses modules that include PP slides, animations, 1 discussion post, and 1 lab. However, if you are taking this class because you want an easy A this may NOT be the class for you. The reading and labs are the hardest part so know that there is work you HAVE to put in. Final and Midterm outweigh EVERYTHING!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is not very difficult but taking it in a 7 week period (online), It is def. A lot of work, you constantly need to be spending time on the lab portions, as they get much complex towards the end. His test very easy, just review the lectures/powerpoints. good professor if you are willing to put in the extra work!

Took him for GEOG1112 online class. As others have said, two exams, ten modules spaced out over the semester w/ labs and discussion postings due every 7-10 days. Do the homework, study the book, lectures and powerpoints and you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I took Dr. Tu for a 4 week spring semester and I thoroughly enjoyed the class. Those who do poorly typically did not to the homework or didn't buy the book. The quiz is straight from the book, and there are assignments do every 2-3 days as this is a shorter class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took Professor Tu for a 4 week summer session. I can't complain at all. There are assignments due every two days, but if you read the textbook they are fun. It is a short session so it is normal to have more work to do, but it was nothing out of the ordinary. I would take him again!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Tu is great. I took him for 7 week GEOG 1112. Ten modules, 5-6 days per module, 1 text book chapter, 1 EASY discussion, and 1 lab each module. Labs can be occasionally tedious, but never hard - 1.5 hours spent on the longer ones at the most. 2 exams which are straight from his powerpoints and textbook. EASY A! Taking him next semester!

Extremely boring lectures. Nicest professor ever who really wants you to succeed in life, as well as his class. Tests are very hard, but he gives hints throughout the lectures about the tests. Great person.

I have taken this professor twice now, once in class and once online. In class, his accent could be a bit of a distraction for some people, but it barely bothered me. I enjoyed his lectures and he was an easy grader. His online course is fairly easy, and he is a very kind grader.

The class wasn't easy, but it wasn't super hard either. I also think it was tough because it was a 7 week course. One thing I can say about Dr. Tu is he's very, very helpful when you need the assistance. He will explain it until you completely understand everything. He does have a very thick accent so that can make understanding him a challenge.
This is a hard class. The tests are nimpossible and the labs are difficult.  There is a lot of reading each week  in addition to the tricky labs.  Take sci 1102 instead.  So much easier.

Dr. Tu is a extremely nice guy but he has a very strong accent which makes him very difficult to understand. The lectures are very long. The tests were hard you basically have to teach yourself the material.

Professor Tu is a really cool guy. He's Chinese so he has an accent, but it's not hard to understand him, plus he explains the material well enough to be clear if you pay attention. He can be repetitive but  that's not necessarily bad. He posts lectures online and the tests are mostly based off them. Reading the text also helps you understand more.

Dr. Tu is a helpful and easy prof. He is nice and will answers questions. Got high A's on everything. He does have a thick Chinese accent, but you get used to it. Tests are literally straight from the powerpoints. Final project is big but easy. If you enjoy discussing environmental issues you will enjoy this class.
Pretty much what everyone has said. He gives a study guide but it can be really different from the exam. Only 2 tests and 1 research paper.

Professor Tu's lectures are boring but posted online. There are two tests, one big research paper, two group discussions and weekly little assignments due every week. Tests can be hard if you don't study. Very very slow to grade assignments etc. and post them up.

Had a tendency to over complicate things. Some of his assignments (especially the 2 from the book) had outlandish scenarios that were difficult to form a solid answer. Labs could be confusing. Test are diffult but if you study some you can pass. Not an easy class but manageable.

Somewhat of a hard accent to understand, but overall a great teacher. His lectures are a little boring. He's extremely helpful with anything you need and nice. His test were a bit hard. I did fairly well in the class.
I had him for Geography 1102 online. He is very helpful and clear on his assignments.
Likes to talk alot, and doesnt finish lectures, but still asks info on tests. Class easy but boring. Attendance is mandatory which can get very boring, bring homework!

Horrible teacher. Labs split into two classes. One group gets the short end of stick; he gives the test with the last lab content before the lab class gets to do the lab. Claims that if you listen to his lectures you'll get a B on tests. Lies. No study guides or reviews. Worst teacher I've had.

Not the most fascinating lecturer, but it was an ok class. His accent made it a bit hard to understand sometimes, but overall it wasn't a problem. His powerpoints are very thorough, and he posts them online. He doesn't make study guides for exams, but he tells you in class what questions to expect on the test. Labs are easy and don't take long.

He is a quirky professor, but also very hard to understand because of his accent.  I read on here that you would get used to the accent, but I would have been lost if he didn't have the powerpoint lectures up during class.  I like how he put the lectures online.  The tests were pretty easy, I just wish I had studied more.

Everyone seems to love this professor, but I had an extremely difficult time even passing this class. There is a lot of memorization involved, and most of the class focused on China rather than Asia as a whole. If you want a complete, comprehensive survey of Asia's Geography seek out another professor. You won't get it here.

His accent is a bit tough at first, but after a week, he is easy to understand!  Very fun classes, he is a great teacher and very knowledgable.  If you go to class, study his powerpoints and read what he tells you, you can easily get an A!  but you have to put a little effort into his class.  He has fun labs, and easy grading!

Great class! Great professor! His English is hard to understand, but he will tell you this on the first day and do everything in his power to make sure you understand him. Test and map quizzes are pretty straight foward just do the work. He rewards effort. One paper on a geographical topic relating to Asia. Pretty simple.

Very easy class. You don't even have to open your text book. Just read over his slides. No one should ever complain about this class being hard! EASY map quizzes, 2 tests, and an easy paper with a presentation. He is SO nice and kind. His English is rough.

Tests and quizzes were difficult, but there are many ways to redeem yourself.  Lectures are boring, pretty much read straight from powerpoint. I'm taking this professor again though. Would recommend him.

His english is hard to get used to. Tests are a little tricky as he mixes words in questions that make you think there could be more than one answer. Teaches straight from powerpoint. uses whole classtime, takes attendance and counts off if you are absent. Knows his stuff, but is very uninteresting with his presentation.
